website_summaries.verdict: Great automatic cleaner for use with in-ground pools. It cleans thoroughly and  has a handy timer function to leave it to do all the work.
pros: Cleans even large pools very well
Durable – will last longer than other models
Auto-mode allows you to set to work while you're away
Easy to clean filter makes maintenance a breeze
cons: It's a little heavy, especially when removing it from the pool
It's not great at cleaning stairs and has a fairly short cord

website_summaries.verdict: Easy setup, speedy cleaning, and a superb filtration system that's simple to maintain help make this consumer-favorite.
pros: A top-selling robotic model that provides multiple cleaning techniques in one – filters debris, scrubs the pool, and vacuums particles
Capable of cleaning pools up to 50 ft. in less than 3 hours
cons: Occasionally gets stuck, but this is a common issue of robotic pool cleaners

customer_reviews.title: For $700 I would have expected this machine to last ...
customer_reviews.text: For $700 I would have expected this machine to last at least one day versus one hour. The machine cleaned the pool well for about 1 hour on its first try then died. I was advised by the company to send it back. Hopefully I don’t get screwed on a restocking fee. The second time I was dumb enough to order directly through poolzoom. The new pool cleaner runs, but does not pick up sands and small debris. This is a $700 piece of junk. After having the unit for 1.5 weeks it now shuts off after 30 minutes. Pool zoom will not refund you as well.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Raines

customer_reviews.title: A Perfected Failure
customer_reviews.text: Machine was IMPECCABLE when it came to cleaning our pool.....at first. We have only had it for a little over a month and it just stopped working. Our pool is unground, uncovered, about 10k gallons salt water, with minimal trees surrounding. All of a sudden it just started shutting off immediately after being turned on. We loved it, but wouldn’t recommend it. Just started return/exchange process today. Will update accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: JBNMI

customer_reviews.title: Bad Warranty!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is good when it is working. However, the warranty sucks. Ours stopped working after 8 months and we have to pay to ship it to get it fixed. This item is not small, nor is it light...so shipping it is not cheap. Very disappointed with this service for such an expensive unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Anton

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE. No Free Return Shipping!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE! 1) This unit doesn't pick up leaves on the pool floor. It kept crossing over the leaves but did not pick up. 2) It does pick up sands and debris. But the machine moves around randomly, leaving some area untouched. 3) If you are not satisfied with the item, YOU have to pay the shipping cost to ship it back. That is almost $60 for me.
customer_reviews.author: P. Li

customer_reviews.title: Had issues after six months
customer_reviews.text: Would never purchase any pool item from BW Industries. Had trouble with warranty and dealing with Jay from BW Industries had a lot to be desired. I previously had the shark. It had no issues and lasted around ten years. Had the dolphin for six months and it doesn’t clean nearly as well as the shark. Next unit I purchase is the shark.
customer_reviews.author: evviesue

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Doesn't last.  Warranty service seems purposefully onerous.
customer_reviews.text: Cleans the floor and walls very well. Does alright on stairs, but not great. Power supply died after about a year. Not long after replacing the power supply, the robot itself stopped being able to move. Only the impeller worked. Trying to get warranty service is a nightmare. I couldn't wait the months it takes to ship it back and have it repaired, so I opened it up myself expecting to find water inside the control box. To my surprise, everything inside was nice and dry. Hooking up 29V directly to the drive motor, it works fine. Something on the control board must have died, which is pretty sad after one year in a perfectly dry environment.
customer_reviews.author: cilynx

customer_reviews.title: must buy for our pool
customer_reviews.text: Simply an outstanding product. Some things that all must know is that it is not well suited for large material such as leaves. Our pool was recently opened and there was general dirt and crud that would take me 3-4 hours to clean up. Using this monster I pitched it in the pool and watched it do it's thing and was amazed at what it was able to do.amazing technology and I am very satisfied with results in less than than 2 hours without me managing the machine.
customer_reviews.author: texasfan

customer_reviews.title: Life changing purchase after cleaning manually for years. 2 years old and going strong
customer_reviews.text: This thing climbs the walls and cleans my 15k gallon pool perfectly. A life changing purchase after cleaning my pool manually for two years with the hose and pole attachment. Keeps the strain off my filters, and the device is on it's second season and going strong. Light enough to lift without a caddy, easy to clean, seems durable and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F

customer_reviews.title: Good but pool specific drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Decided to invest in the Dolphin Nautilus CC Plus as I’ve had to replace my Polaris every few years. As other reviewers have noted it’s easy, efficient, and maneuvers up the walls. However, I can’t run it without being outside and watching as it gets tripped up on the steps and built in seat. It eventually makes it back to the pool bottom but it keeps repeating the effort. After a while I start feeling sorry for it because it’s so persistent. Perhaps I didn’t read the specs well enough for each model but I definitely made a mistake with this model. Just make sure you choose the right model.
customer_reviews.author: PAK

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: When it operates the one track comes off and then the unit doesn't run. Have to keep unplugging and plugging in to get it to operate. Also requested a return and Backyard Pool Superstore charges a 20% restocking fee. How is that fair on a defective product. I would not purchase from this store again. They expect you to send the robot back to the manufacturer for warranty. Umm this is a brand new unit. So I have to go through the hassle of drying the unit, re boxing it, driving it to ups or FedEx and ship it then wait for repair. Jeez I should be a dealer myself, no responsibility. Horrible way to conduct business.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Love this little blue guy!
customer_reviews.text: The answer to all things pool! I was really worried about purchasing this because it seems so expensive, but trust me, it is worth every last penny. If you love to vacuum your pool, then this is not for you. If however, you could go through life and never miss having to vacuum again, then just fork out the cash, buy this guy, toss him in your pool and sand, leaves and debris be gone! The best thing ever! PS. buy the stupid cart thing because if not, you will be like me, ordering it later... LOL enjoy! You are going to love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Weller

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 10 uses, no response from manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on August 10th, 2019. I was quite pleased with the initial quality and used it several times at the end of last season. It shorted out immediately the first time I tried to use it this year. I reached out to the manufacturer two weeks ago via their web site (as the sticker on the device instructs you to do) and did not receive a response. Now I have a very expensive broken vacuum and I don't know if I'm supposed to find someone to repair it or buy a replacement from a different manufacturer and seek a refund from Amazon or otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: D. Belcher

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!  Going to give me more play time and less work!  Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Here is a before and after after two cycles. This model does have a smaller basket size, but given the attached pictures will likely be the most leaves I have in the pool i wasn’t too concerned. The before is when I opened the pool in the spring, and the latter picture is after two cycles. Of note, I don’t think it was able to keep vacuuming given my baskets got overflowing with leaves. But, it is now spotless. I did purchase the caddy separate for moving and storage. I will try to update as to it’s durability in another year or two.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Warranty doesnt cover a rip off "inspection fee" of $75
customer_reviews.text: The product is good until it breaks, should let people know that if the product breaks authorized repair places even with warranty will charge you a $75 "inspection fee" when even i know it doesnt need inspected the power supply has failed and needs replaced. Have to milk the customers somehow. and no the "Labor" part of the warranty doesnt cover it. Never had this issue with the Polaris i owned under warranty you took it, they fixed it no charge to the customer. The repair places will rip you off. PS owned for 10 months
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: The dogs sure enjoy barking at it!
customer_reviews.text: We do like the nautilus plus but it does have some disappointing flaws. It does get stuck on stairs, ledges, and unusually shaped areas. It does miss several areas and seems to repeat the same already cleaned sections while missing untouched others. It doesn't get into corners at all. But it does save us many hours a week of vacuuming time so it is worth the money in spite of it's imperfections.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn P

customer_reviews.title: Say hello to my little friend
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! I had a pool service & got rid of them actually after I got this because I realized the pool looked better after one cycle with this than right after they leave. I leave my guy in & he runs once a day. I’ve got lots of lovely trees & bushes with teeny tiny flowers all around the pool and it is great with the debris. I was not happy about dropping nearly a grand between the cart & machine. I had just replastered after buying the house. This thing is worth every penny. The pool looks amazing every time I go look at it now.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Weak Suction Power
customer_reviews.text: PSU died after one season. I have to find the Dolphin Dealer, No Web Site for customer service for repair. Dolphin pool cleaner has very weak suction power, doesn’t pick up debris well from the floor of pebble tech pool. Furthermore, desipte of fact that there are enough room in 4 compartments, the openings are tightly clogged with leaves, pine needles, it doesn’t get reach to compartment inside, have to unplug debris for 3-4 times to clean whole area of the pool. I had Aqua Cobia XL before this, it sucks everything up from the floor, with one time operation. I regret to buy Dolphin, I will go back to Aqua.
customer_reviews.author: Snow Girl

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for bad design, it will get beat up from regular use!
customer_reviews.text: The low profile edge design will cause it to get beat up in a matter of years, this sounds like no big deal but when you spend $800 on a pool robot you generally expect it to not happen this way. Go for a big wheel design that will "protect" the chassis (wheels are a wear and tear part NOT the chassis). Also no real time remote control to spot clean. Ports are too small and clog up way too fast. Lasly, our motor went out it seems after only 2 years, and "it's cheaper to buy a whole new maytronics than replace the motor.." Yeah, no thank MayNotTronics! The answer is design better, for future breakage.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Warrior Mom

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review: Product only as good as its weakest part
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, we have a 30,000 gallon vinyl above ground pool and it's never been cleaner. This thing was worth every penny. Its reliable and saves me a lot of time. This is my first year with it. *****Updated 8/11/18************* The robot hardware works great, unfortunately after 3 months of use the power supply stopped working, I reached out to the manufacturer without any response. Because Its somewhat urgent to get the pool cleaned up and not let debris build up I was forced to purchase a new power supply for $210. Very disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Defective item.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this model on Amazon less than a month ago. Did not open and use til this past week and ran it three times. First 2 uses the cleaner preformed very well, cleaned entire pool in about 2 hrs. Very easy to clean and maintain. Third time out it ran fine, but I could tell it was losing suction when pivoting, then it just quit moving. I am returning now since it’s under the 30 day purchase window. I am going to give this product another try and hope my unit was just defective and not systematically flawed. Will review again once I receive my new unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Nine Days - Poolzoom issued less than 50% Refund
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great for the first four or five days, then like so many others point out the tracks start to come off. Found it in the middle of the pool, opened it up, cleaned impeller, etc. Would start than die. If I could give this a zero I would. DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH POOL ZOOM. Read the fine print. They do everything they can to discourage you from returning to them. I'm sorry, nine days in I should be able to return for a full refund. Shame on me for not reading the fine print or all the negative reviews. Shameless crooks, no honor, no dignity or class.
customer_reviews.author: C Blackpoole

customer_reviews.title: Good pool cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Good automatic pool cleaner, I may need a model with different rollers than this one as the surface is only cleaned on the edge of the rollers with my gunite pool. I would also issue a warning if you are ordering from seller Pool Zoom. I paid $333.93 for UPS ground shipping, New Jersey to New Hampshire. I see the seller Pool Zoom is now offering free shipping, but pay close attention to shipping cost if ordering from Pool Zoom to avoid being gouged for shipping
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: but it was so easy. It was so much better than having to ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness!! I could not imagine having a pool without this cleaner. We filled up our pool using our extra well which has a ton of iron in it. This cleaner got all of the iron out. I had to clean the filters about every 30 minutes, but it was so easy. It was so much better than having to vacuum while on backwash! I love the fact that it is not connected to the pool or water supply.
customer_reviews.author: Peach shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works great in Above Ground Pool
customer_reviews.text: My new friend, Flipper, has been a great addition to the family. He has saved me hours of cleaning my 27' round Above Ground Pool. He even tries to clean the waterline by easily climbing the walls and then running around the edge. Though he misses a lot of the waterline, he doesn't miss any of the bottom debris. Great little robot. The only complaint, and why I did not give him 5 stars, is that he is a bit one the heavy side. Taking him out of the water is a bit of an effort. Luckily he has a handle which makes it much easier.
customer_reviews.author: E. Timmie

customer_reviews.title: It works, pricy but compared to the ones at Shasta Pools, way cheaper!
customer_reviews.text: Just finished first cycle. It cleaned up 90% of the fine dirt that gets into my pool from the AZ desert. The pics show you how much it picked up. (ALOT) I'm going to run it again. Overall I'm happy with it. I'll probably vacuum the pool manually once a month or so but now my weekly cleanings are a thing of the past I think.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Best money I have spent and customer service was awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product I've bought from my pool. I rely on this robot all year around.. I have now owned this product about 2 years and had to come back to write a review. Ours came with a 3 year warranty, and the motor died last week. We did have to pay to return ship, but it was back in 3 days with a new motor and some other parts replaced. Customer support was awesome. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Haddix

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be defective
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this due to all of the high ratings this machine has received. I feel that I may have received a defective unit as It is usually stuck on one specific wall of the pool as opposed to spreading it's time throughout the entire pool. It's really odd that it always ends up in the same place, cleaning the same area. It also struggles greatly on steps and curved walls. It also spends a good deal of time floating while the wheels turn. It seems that I have a defective unit due to it's inability to navigate the pool. I will be returning due to defectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Kamren Harris

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this cleaner for my 16x36 inground pool. Ran ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this cleaner for my 16x36 inground pool. Ran it for the first time and it has left black marks all over my brand new white plaster pool. Extremely disapointed as the marks do not brush off. I think it is from the side of the cleaner rubbing up against the pool. DO NOT purchase if you have a plaster/concrete pool.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: So far doing a fine job
customer_reviews.text: Have had the Dolphin Nautilus a little over a month now and it does a really good job of keeping my in ground pool sparkling clean. My pool stood for over a month while I was trying to get my old cleaner repaired. The dealer was not able to figure out what was wrong with my 3 year old cleaner, which had been in an out of the shop during the three years I owned it. When it was clear my old cleaner was not able to be repaired, I began shopping for a new cleaner and found the Dolphin got good reviews, and was considerably less expensive than the previous cleaner I had.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! We just bought this to replace our Polaris cleaner, and after one use, I’m already very impressed. This was very easy to unbox and get going. I was skeptical about this not coming with the cart to wheel it around, but I think I’m actually going to like not having it, as it will be easier to store. The suction power is very good compared to our old robot, and having the two sets of scrubbers really helps minimize how much junk gets blown around the pool once it’s run over. My favorite part is the buoy to keep the cord from tangling. Very pleased so far!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I just opened my pool and had a lot of algae, so I brushed the sides of pool and shocked it. It left a lot of dead algae and had lots of leaves in the bottom of the pool as well. I plugged it in and worked like a charm. It was so nice to do other work around the yard and 2 hours later had a crystal clear pool. I wish I would have bought this YEARS ago!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen White

customer_reviews.title: Works after repaired
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Nautilus 2 weeks ago and it worked fine until today. The belt wrapped around the side of the unit and stretched it tight. Tried to call Matronics customer service and that is a joke. After an hour, no one to answer phone. If I bought one of these again, I'd pay the $200 more and buy from a local company where I could bring it back to them to fix. Update: I was able to return unit to Matronics. They repaired it under warranty and shipped it back fast. Working fine again, but I still would probably buy locally if I had to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Best pool cleaner ever - update
customer_reviews.text: Best pool cleaner I have ever had. This is an update to my last review. It's been almost 2 years and the only thing I done to it is replace the foam climbing rings. My house is built around my pool so everything that hits the roof winds up in the pool. I usually run the cleaner twice a day. The durability of this cleaner has been fantastic. I could not be happier. Update: over 2 years old could not be happier. After 2 years i did have to replace the rollers, sponge rings & belts but i run it 2-3 times a day. This is the greatest pool cleaner - all others i have had were junk in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. McCulloch

customer_reviews.title: Cleans so much better than Polaris, using far less energy
customer_reviews.text: We've been using a Dolphin Nautilus Robotic Pool Cleaner in our in-ground pool for over two years. It has two washable filters that take about five minutes to rinse. It cleans so much better than our old Polaris. The difference was visibly dramatic after the first time we used the Nautilus. It also uses far less energy than the Polaris 3/4 HP booster pump. We couldn't be more pleased. Definitely deserves a Five Star rating!
customer_reviews.author: C. Owenby

customer_reviews.title: So far works well
customer_reviews.text: Put it in the pool turned it on cleaned well, missed a couple of spots, picked up leaves and small sticks, didn't pick up sand. So I installed set of pleated filters and ran it again, this time it picked up the sand. It climbs the walls all the way to the water level, trys to clean the steps, but doesn't do a good job on them, so sweep them first. Very easy to clean the filters. If it cleaned the steps and didn't miss a couple of spots I'd give it 5 stars. This is going to make my job very easy, I'll update review after I have had it for awhile, so far very nice machine.
customer_reviews.author: kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Spotless!
customer_reviews.text: Ladies and gentlemen, meet Paul. He comes to us from the mystical world of Amazon. With no time to dawdle, he was thrown in to the deep end! He frolicked for a few minutes, happily exploring his new digs. Before long, he was climbing the walls. The joy was evident. He never took a break until the pool was spotless! In good conscious, we could not name him Jake or Jake 2.0. Jake will remain sidelined pending the ever elusive part "53". He will not be disassembled. He will forever be remembered for his love for Darlene. May Paul have that same passion.
customer_reviews.author: Alisonroutt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, awesome, awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is the best! I did many, many searches for a self contained pool vacuum and each time I came back to the dolphin Nautilus CC Plus! Being our first vacuum of this type we did a lot of research. It paid off because this vacuum is awesome! It is so easy to clean the filters. Just pull them out and squirt them with hose. I absolutely recommend this vacuum! Definitely worth the money. No more back washing, rinsing or getting out the house and bulky Vacuum either! I love it! Oh, and it cleans the sides too!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: update from original review. Have now used this unit a dozen plus times in my relatively small pool, 10000 gal, concrete. This is the third robot I have owned during my pool career and this thing is just a piece of junk. After it’s cycle, maybe 3 hrs, I still have debris in a mid point of the pool and in the shallow end. This cleaner gets stuck in the deeper side of the pool, 5 ft. This thing got great reviews but it does a terrible job in my pool
customer_reviews.author: gregory a haub

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty much an expensive gamble
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this thing but the quality control just continued to disappoint. In the 5 times it worked it worked very well, but then one of the treads fell off the tracks and got jammed. It cost me my own shipping to send it back to Maytronics for a fix. Then it worked well.. for another 4 times.. before the same problem occurred. How many more times do I have to pack this heavy thing up and pay $50 shipping to get the same clunker back? Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Keeps pool clean.  No work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this before last year swim season. Wanted to wait to review until used it for a season. I am extremely pleased. It climbs walls, does not get stuck, climbs a couple of stairs, cleans the whole pool in about 2 hours (16X32 plaster sport pool). The cord does not tangle. It does a great job of cleaning the pool and leaves the water sparkling clean. Never need to hand brush the walls. Just drop it in and push the button. It even works underneath the safety cover. The filters are easy to remove and clean with top loading. I would recommend getting the caddy for ease of storage and moving it
customer_reviews.author: J. Francom

customer_reviews.title: Good Vac so far
customer_reviews.text: 25’ x 50’ gunite pool. So far so good, easy set up, just throw it in the pool and let it do it’s thing. I had a Blue Diamond vac for 12 years just changed the rollers and belts once, very good vac but the pump finally gave out. The Dolphin definitely climbs better, the cord does not tangle as much and seems to do a better job cleaning. The only thing everything is made much lighter then the Blue Diamond not sure if it will hold up. Update Went through a whole Northeast season with it and it held up well.
customer_reviews.author: SLeo

customer_reviews.title: Essentially Useless
customer_reviews.text: If your pool has steps, this thing is basically useless unless you are willing to check on it every 10 minutes. No matter what, it winds up sideways straddling 2 steps and just spins its wheels. When it runs it works fine, but it spends so little time actually cleaning the bottom of the pool because it is always hung up on the steps. I used to own an Aquabot and while it was harder to clean the filter, it did not get "hung up" nearly as often as this thing does.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten one a long time ago, fantastic product, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Have had a in-ground pool now for 20 years and had always used the cleaner you have to hook up the side pressure hose too. Well I did some research and purchased this product and can't say enough how satisfied I am!! Should have gotten one years ago. The unit is easily placed in pool, just touch the on pad and away she goes. Cleans great. When its finished it shuts off and you remove from pool. Open the two top doors and remove filter elements, clean them and ready for the next time. It can be heavy when removing, but keep in mind its full of water so just ease it out to allow draining.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With This Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Our Pool was finished about 2 weeks ago and I spent time searching for a good robotic pool sweep. Based on reviews I ordered this one. It was extremely easy to set up, basically just unwrapping the sweep and connecting a hose. The control unit is simple to use, but I wish it had more of a digital display for different types of settings. The first time in the pool, I set it for a 3 hour clean and it brought tons of sand, dirt, leaves and even chunks of the pebble tech that I had been manually sweeping towards the drain. Very happy with this product and will be even happier if it lasts a few years or more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing robot!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 17' x 55' pool that is not enclosed, so I get debris constantly. This robot works excellent, just put it in the pool, connect to the power supply and turn it on, a couple hours later and it has removed all of the debris and captured it in the filter cartridges. Clean out only takes a few minutes, then back on the dolly and roll to the garage. This machine cleans the walls and even the water line, sometimes partially coming out of the water as it travels along the water line. It is the only robot I've had, so I can't compare to the others but for me it was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Foster

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: If your use to a Polaris cleaning your pool do not buy this. It only cleaned half the pool in 3 hours. I had to run it 9 hours to fully cover the bottom of the pool then it was time to run it again. Then the drive belt slipped off and it sat there for an hour doing nothing. The power supply works sometimes. I had to unplug it then plug it back in a couple times for it to work. The idea id great but if you have a booster pump....................stick with a polaris.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W.

customer_reviews.title: Henry, (our nautilus robot) does a great job- far superior to the barracuda we had before
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this is a very expensive pool cleaner. It is not often I get such an expensive model of something. our old pool cleaner did a lousy job and had poor coverage of the pool. We also left it in the pool all the time so it could run everyday to try to get the entire pool. This made the pool less attractive with a big hose always ruining the look. We put the nautilus once a week for three hours and its done and the entire pool is clean.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bear

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought a house with a pool and was quickly looking for a solution to clean the pool bottom. Started researching pool robots and the Dolphin was always a top rated choice. This think works, does his thing in 2 hours and our pool looks great every day. Worth the money and then some. Easy to use, easy to clean filter. The only negative is the control panel, would like to maybe see more display like time left in cycle, schedule, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have a minor problem with one of the holder tabs does not line up with the filter correctly. Called customer service and waited for 45 minutes on hold and no one ever picked up. Tried the internet help. They asked for a picture of the issue and a copy of the receipt. I sent them and no response even after asking again. I can not recommend this product if this is the service you get on a brand new unit!
customer_reviews.author: Cooperbrowdy

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I up graded to this machine after reading reviews and watching the video of it's performance. It does all it was advertised to do. My problem is when it goes up a step it flips to it's side and can't get straight and shuts off so the motor doesn't burn out. this happened 3 times the first time I used it. I called the manufacturer and was told this was normal. Advertising doesn't tell you that. Now I have to watch the damn thing clean the pool so I can be there to take it off the steps when it goes to clean them. Yes, disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Cusack

customer_reviews.title: YOU WONT REGRET THE MONEY SPENT ON THIS POOL CLEANER!
customer_reviews.text: I thought about this and thought about this and thought about this even bought a hand held instead. Finally I took a leap and gave this a try. This takes all of the stress of the hose, pump, pushing and pulling and most importantly loss of my TIME prepping to enjoy our pool. After reading other reviews I was expecting it to get stuck on the stairs but IT DIDN'T GET STUCK! It's GREAT! simple set up plug and play and great tips on YouTube as well. I Highly recommend Dolphin Nautilus CC Plus Automatic Robotic Pool Cleaner .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I owned two Aquabots prior to this. I was reluctant to purchase because of the higher price but am I glad I did. The cord doesn't get as twisted as the Aquabot. I doesn't get stuck on the drain like the Aquabot. The filter is easier to clean. I almost sent it back not realizing there are two different filters supplied and the filter that is designed for heavy debris is in the unit when it arrives. The fine particle filter was not in the unit so initially it wasn't picking up dirt. I can't speak to durability as I have only had it a few months. Great unit. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ny

customer_reviews.title: So much better than our old one!  Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Yes! This replaced one that died. I Did a lot of Research before investing so much money in a new one. I have Zero Regrets. My husband loves it too. He is Very Impressed. Suction gets everything and it’s easy to clean the filters. It really gets the waterline too! Pops up to the coping and cleans very well. Even gets dirt etc on the seams- which our other one never did. Very powerful motor and cleans our pool in only about 30 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Big Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: It does an OK job cleaning dirt off of flat surfaces and that's about all it's good for IMO. It has a difficult time with sand and does a horrible job cleaning around the edges, in corners or any type of transition areas. It left about a 6" area around the outer perimeter where it failed to pick up any dirt or sand at all. I did not have any leaves in my pool so I can't speak to how well, or poorly, it may do sucking them up. For the high price tag it should do a much better job.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Andreottola

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome robot!
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered a day early, which is a plus! Easy to assemble. Plug in, put in the pool and turn it on. So far it is running circles around the Polaris. I will try to do an update in a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Amy T

customer_reviews.title: The best pool cleaner I ever owned.  Climbs my stairs, walls and even my safety ledge
customer_reviews.text: Talk about an easy pool cleaner to have. I been leaving it my pool 24x7 throughout this summer. I have it set to turn on once a day. It cleans ever spot in my pool and even my steps and the safety ledge I have all around the deep end. This robot is great. It climbs the walls so High that I think its going to jump out of the pool but it always seems to fall back in and keeps on going. I named the robot Johnny 5 from short circuit because this things never gives up. Cleaning the filters couldnt be easier. Overall an amazing product and so worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H@VABEACH

customer_reviews.title: Good robotic cleaner power supply fussy
customer_reviews.text: The cleaner works well and covers the pool without getting stuck on the bottom drain. It does not clean the steps but I did not expect it to. The panels are easy to remove and hose down, much better that the cloth bag on my old Aquabot. The power supply works but has requirement to be 12 ft from the pool and raised 4 inches. Some small feet would have been helpful. It also is only water resistant not waterproof. Not sure what this means but I have protected it from rain. I have only used it for 4 cleaning cycles so will comment on durability later.
customer_reviews.author: PHIL

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 Haward Aquavacs in the past that performed reasonably well until they fail, but at over $800 and only using them 4 months a year, they fail too soon. I replaced my second with this cleaner and this one cleans much faster, is a better design for filters and comes with an additional set of spring filters which makes the initial clean a lot quicker and easier.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: This Goomer Goes.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pool robot in 13 seasons.One Hayward Shark and two Hayward Tiger Sharks. This is the BEST of any pool robots I have had. My pool in an old rectangular cement pool builtin the 1960's. It has sharp corners and the deep end is bowl like. This Dolphin (nicknamed the Naughty-C) Quickly goes about the business of cleaning up the bottom and sides of the pool. It struggles a little with the steps, but, I brush that debris in the pool and Naughty -C goes and gets it. So as far as getting the job done, I rate an A-. Will let you know about longevity and repair if applicable.
customer_reviews.author: Smoothie Dude

customer_reviews.title: Tread keeps coming off the wheel track.
customer_reviews.text: Within the first week that we had the Nautilus CC Plus , the tread came off the wheel track. We were lucky that we were able to ship it back for repair for free. However, the repair( shaving foam and adjusting the wheel track) did not fix the problem. They second time we used it post repair we had to put the the tread back on the wheel track. 2/3 of the time we use the cleaner the tread comes off the track and we have to put it back on to finish the pool cleaning. Very annoying! It does a great job cleaning , but you have to watch it constantly to put it back together. Very Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great BUY
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this cleaner for a month almost everyday and it does great job keeping my pool clean. Only one time it got stuck behind the stairs which was an easy fix. If you have back problems I would recommend someone to lift this cleaner out of the pool since it can be a little heavy till the water drains out. Easy to clean. Do not purchase the caddy which is very flimsy. As you can see In the picture how I store My cleaner when not being used. It’s a lot of money but well worth it especially those hot days when you don’t feel like cleaning your pool.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah H. Harley

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I researched pool robots for a year before I decided on the Nautilus and it turned out to be the best investment I have made since we got a pool. Could not be happier with how well it cleans and could not be easier to use. I purchased the caddy a few weeks after to make it even easier and more convenient. The number of hours this little guy has saved me from vacuuming has made it basically pay for itself. Easy to clean washable filters and simple as can be to take apart and reassemble. Even gets the water line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reduced Rating Due to Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Originally provided 5 stars, we popped the filters in, put the machine in the pool and it was amazing! However, we realized black marks being left in the pool. We examined the product and noticed bumpers were missing on one side . We contacted customer service and the seller a week ago. A request of a picture of sku as if the app isn’t affiliated was made. Okay. Zero follow-up thus far. Buyer beware. As long as your products arrives with all of its parts, Wonderful. However if you should require customer service, BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: LovingEveryday

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I've made in this pool
customer_reviews.text: My old Polaris had just about given up the ghost - should have been replaced 3 years ago, when I bought the house. So the pool has been an unending nuisance to keep clean, to the point I was ready to have it filled in. My pool service person finally brought over her Dolphin just to show me how it ran. Wow! It cleans the entire pool up past the waterline; the pool has never looked better, and it stays looking good. I run it as needed; it's easy to clean the filters. It has made the pool the pleasure I knew it could be. I can recommend with no hesitation at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had our dolphin for almost two years now. I don’t think there’s ever been a higher ticket item that has ever been so worth the money than this little fellow! It has saved us SO much money in pool service. We have an Airbnb, so keeping the pool clean is a priority, and we are surrounded by pine trees and more, so once a week cleaning by the pool cleaners was not sufficient. I plop this guy in for a couple of hours before my guests arrive, or while they’re gone during the day, and WALLA, sparkling clean pool! They only thing I would do differently in my purchase would be to get the one with the remote control.
customer_reviews.author: markelli

customer_reviews.title: This thing Sucks !!!  in a good way
customer_reviews.text: Set is and forget it. No worries with this vacuum just push 2 buttons and you are set for the week. By set i mean the pool is going to be debris free. The filters are easy to clean with 2 twist locking hooks on both filters. Easy to empty and options on the type of filters you can put in the dolphin. I have very shallow steps (8" deep) so it does have difficulty there as it is wider than the steps but this happens with all auto vacuums. Aside from my steps there is no extra work or attention needed. Good value in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JNick

customer_reviews.title: BROKE after 4 months. Do NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in May 2020. It is now August 2020 and we are paying $153 at the UPS Store to ship the robot to the mechanic place to be repaired because it already stopped working! It would power on and then power off after about four seconds. We do not get refunded or credited anything for shipping either and Dolphin only pays for repairs done by their mechanic. ABSOLUTELY do not waste your money. You're better off spending your $800 on a pool boy for the summer. Giant piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: tasha clitesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: First it came 1 day early. Second, I kept looking for more instructions. It can't be this simple, could it? Unpack, pull the plastic protecters off the 4 wheels, connect the power cord to the unit, plug in, drop into the pool, turn on, choose days to clean...DONE. After the first cleaning cycle was complete, I pulled the filters out and there was so much sand/dirt picked up by the unit that I was amazed. I washed them out reinserted and did another cleaning today. It's only been 24 hours but I'm very impressed. I'll update in a few weeks but I'm sold on this unit.
customer_reviews.author: NatT

customer_reviews.title: Good Cleaner, But Not as Good as Hayward Tiger Shark
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job cleaning overall. Compared to the Hayward Tiger Shark that I replaced this with though, it is not as good. This cleaner does not have as strong suction. It also sometimes either goes too fast causing it to prematurely come off the wall or bounce up off the bottom. Maybe as it gets used more it will not come off it’s route so easy. On the plus side it is easier to get out of the water and the filter removal on the top great. It is a solid cleaner - I just hope it last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: So we got ours May 5 today is June 22. The video leaves out what the other 3 buttons do and I am pretty sure I still don’t know, i just press 1. It seems to like certain areas in our pool and not like others. If you have something in the pool like a hose it will get tangled in that, seems to like that too. Overall it cleans 80% of the pool so I still end up manually vacuuming a bit. I still haven’t figured out why sometimes if you want to run it at a different time i have to turn it on then off then on and repeat until it finally runs.
customer_reviews.author: B. Valenti

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: I owned an older version of this robot that was a hand-me-down from a family member. It had sat idle for more than a year by the time I received it, so the motor mechanism ended up rusting out after a few months of use. But I was already hooked. So I bought this model to replace the old one, and have had it over a year now. It is a fantastic little machine. It performs much better than any water pressure powered cleaners I've had, and it is super easy to use and clean. Highly recommend for small to medium size pools.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine F.

customer_reviews.title: My great little robot pool cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. It says that it does not run the waterline, however, it will do waterline in short stretches as it runs sideways across the walls. This product is as simple as it claims and I really like that. Pull it out of the box. Remove the wrapping. Find a spot for the power supply. Drop it in the water, push the power button, select day frequency and forget it. I was shocked as I could see lines in the pool where it had been. Not now as my pool is as clean as I’ve ever seen it. He is so cool to watch him buzz around. He is a very hard worker, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Beach Dog

customer_reviews.title: I almost gave up on my pool
customer_reviews.text: I've had an inground pool since 1978. It served us well until about 10 years ago. That's when our youngest went off to college. The pool doesn't get much use and the maintenance needs more effort. Over the years we've worn out 3 Polaris sweeps and wasted much energy running booster pumps and changing tires, bags, etc... The Dolphin Nautilus CC Plus Automatic Robotic Pool Cleaner had to be run every third day and did a better job and the filter is much easier to clean. Overall it should save time and energy to keep my pool clean.
customer_reviews.author: pX

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I've been running this pool cleaner once or twice a day for the entire time since I bought this machine 3 weeks ago. It is outstanding in all categories. Its suction is excellent. But for me the easy cleaning and easy removal and reassemble is the greatest feature. After having to deal with a bag style cleaner for a number of years I'm so happy with this cleaners design. My previous cleaner became unreliable after the first summer and I spent hundreds repairing it over a four year period before giving up. I'm hoping my new cleaner stays reliable beyond one season.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just six months working good
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pool cleaner robot, I bought it six months ago and it has been used about 20 times, one month ago the cleaner stopped working after running half hour and it keeps doing the same since then; I live in South America so I won't be able to apply the warranty because sending the robot back and bringing it again would cost more than a new unit, I expected a longer life working without issues, but it was not my case, I review other cases and apparently it is a common issue, it seems to be like a lottery, if you get the prize you won’t be happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Not The Best!
customer_reviews.text: I tried liking this Pool Cleaner BUT it has always been difficult to use on the "SELECTIONS" 1 2 or 3. You always have to power the Cleaner off to go to the next number and that's when it will "sometimes work" or "NOT work". As of today it has TOTALLY quit working 9-28-2020. Bought it in 2019. I use it once a week because I have a very clean swimming pool. I brush and skim daily. My last Pool Cleaner lasted 8 years and happy to say it still works BUT a little heavier in weight. Money wasted on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great vac
customer_reviews.text: So far so great. When we moved into our new home the pool was greenish and getting worse everyday. We bought this after reading the reviews. We put this thing to work right away. A few days later and you would have thought we drained the pool, scrubbed it down and filled it back up. Water was crystal clean and the sides of the pool was clean too. This thing does wonders. Even if I only get a couple of seasons out of it it's still cheaper than paying someone to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Kory

customer_reviews.title: Give this a try!
customer_reviews.text: Guys- I have heard there are duds- but mine is just awesome! Seriously has changed our pool routine for the better! I love this machine and at a better price you can't beat it. I haven't had to deal with customer service so I can't speak to that. However, my husband and I agree that this is the best thing we have purchased for pool maintenance. It cleans the water line very well, gets all surfaces in the pool, and really has just impressed us. We read all the reviews and though- well- it's worth a try. Trust us- try it. Ours is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne Hoefler

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: We owned a previous dolphin for 9 years. It finally needed replace. This product does a better job of cleaning the water line. I was skeptical initially since the filter cartridges did not seem to have the filter area our old bag model did, however, it doesn't seems to get clogged during normal use. The cleaning of the filter cartridges is MUCH easier than the old bag, so I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff MCDONALD

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver for a Pool Owner
customer_reviews.text: We use to own a shark pool cleaner but it would constantly blow bearings. We ordered the dolphin nautilus and its been great. Our old cleaner did have the wifi option so we ordered on without but if we had to do it again we would definitely get it bc it would be great to control from elsewhere someday. But we wouldn't trade our pool vac for anything. We told my sister about it after she got a pool, she was hesitant but then agreed and bought one, saying "every pool needs one" lol.
customer_reviews.author: tracey g.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but works real good
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaces a Dolphin I had for over ten years. The old one used a cloth bag for debris. My old unit did a good job. I like my pool clean and she delivered reliably. I’m very impressed with the new Dolphin. It is quick. It runs all the way up the walls and gets up to the waterline. The new design for the debris basket is much improved. It gets leaves, cherry pits and sand. And the baskets are easier to quickly empty and rinse. It works real good. End of story.
customer_reviews.author: E. Eddie Edwards

customer_reviews.title: It sure is nice, hope it lasts
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with the speed in which this cleans my 16x30 in ground pool. However one of the track belts keeps falling off the track. This does prevent the machine from even turning on, which i guess is a good thing, but we have only had this for < 1 month. I am thinking that the high rate of speed in which it runs into either the pool ladder or stairs may be causing the issue. The filters do a great job and are very easy to clean. You get a micro set and a normal set of filters. Would give a 5, except for the track problem. Will update at end of season.
customer_reviews.author: Heffa

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment Ever
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a year now and can say that it is the best investment I have ever made for trouble free pool cleaning. I run it quite often and it does just as good as doing it by hand. Drop it in and press start. 2 to 3 hrs later its done. Does a very good job at the water line as well but not meant to. Senses dirt, sand, leaves and picks it all up. When done, lift it from the water, pull out the filters and hose them off. You're done until its needed again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in July of 2018. I used it through October when our season ended. When i opened the pool this year I used it with the manual vacuum. The was the last I manually cleaned in the 5 months it's been open. I really didn't think it would work. I was told it was one of the best and it really does the job. So many times I've put it in thinking I would have to back it up by hand but I never have to. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: T. P. Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1st use..
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had this item for a month and already the robot is having wheel issues. I suspected something was strange when I took it out if the box because it had scratches on the front and back of the unit, almost like this was used or refurbished. I used it once and it worked fine but a few weeks later the drive motor isnt working at all! I had kept it in our pool.room closet, out of sun and weather. Not sure what the deal is but it is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Enigma1677

customer_reviews.title: Monster
customer_reviews.text: The filters are really easy to clean. This thing is a monster compared to the pool bot we used to have. In fact, we had not removed the old one yet when we first dropped this puppy in and set it running. It ran right over the old one and kept right on going LOL! The suction on walls is great too. I will try to remember to post an update at the end of the season once I see how well it performs longer term...but so far it surpasses our old bot.
customer_reviews.author: PJM

customer_reviews.title: I have not been disappointed. This machine does great at vacuuming all this ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm new at pool ownership and purchased the Dolphin N Plus primarily because of the other reviews. I have not been disappointed. This machine does great at vacuuming all this needs to be gone! It took 2 days (2 runs at 2 hours each run), but after the pool had sat neglected for several weeks (I'm the new owner), it was in bad shape with tons of leaves at the bottom of the pool, sides and on the steps. Now, it is spotless. It is easy to take in and out of the water, easy to clean the filters and easy to put in and start her up. I'm recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Belle Blaney

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: I opted for this product instead of a well known brand recommended by my pool installer. This one is about $300 cheaper than his recommendation and am very happy with my decision to purchase the Dolphin. The vacuum works great and captures large debris and small dirt particles. I typically run it twice to ensure it covers the full area of the pool. So far it hasn’t gotten stuck on the floor drains, but it has gotten hung up on the steps once (my are full width across the shallow end) and the safety line fixture once; not a big deal. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Good job but wont shut off
customer_reviews.text: Liked it but it seems like it should just do one side of the pool at a time and work its way down. This thing is all over the place ...back and forth. Stumbled on the steps a little and then just stopped after 2 hours. I guess it was done but the lights didnt tirnoff. I shut it down. Unplugged and pulled it out of the pool. Update: the 2nd time I used it the same thing happened. After running for 2.5 hours it just stopped in the pool. The lights stayed on and it didnt shut down on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Tina L Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Service
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other products like this one and the Dolphin Nautilus CC Plus is definitely the best for cleaning my pool. However, after about a year the power source stopped working. That was when I found out how fabulous the customer service is. They had a new power source to me in two days! I couldn't have asked for better service. I would definitely recommend the product and the company.
customer_reviews.author: S. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Good product with one critical flaw
customer_reviews.text: Good product, effective robot pool cleaner except for one critical flaw: the extension cord is very short. Unless you have a small yard and/or a small pool, it will not be able to reach and clean your entire pool. First thought of course is to use an extension cord but the instructions explicitly warn to never use an extension cord. For a product costing $800 I'm surprised to find such a basic flaw and surprised that it hasn't been corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Filmlover2008

customer_reviews.title: Perfect robot
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a different pool robot but I did my research before buying this and it is worth it. Climbs walls and steps with ease and does a great job of cleaning the entire pool. Picks up big leaves and all. No need to buy filters, just empty out every couple days and good to go. Even has 2 types of filters for big or fine particles. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It climbs the walls and the stairs. It seems like it does whatever it wants in the pool though. Doesn’t get the pool all the way clean in 1 run so I have to do another. It beats hand cleaning. And even though it climbs the stairs, it doesn’t get them clean. Very simple to operate. There is only 2 buttons on the power panel: Power and Time Mode. Super simple to clean. Just pop open one of the two filter doors on top and pull them out. This thing is so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: 🍟

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Vacuum, but broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: Vacuums well, but every time I put it in the pool one on the tractor treads would come off stopping operation. It's a month old and under warrantee, but I was required to send it in at my expense which came to $120 for packing and shipping. Have not received to back yet. Good product, but pray it doesn't break.
customer_reviews.author: David Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I really love the vacuum. I have a fiberglass pool 36x16 ft. It does the entire thing other than the tanning deck, I don’t think there is enough water on the deck to make the vacuum happy. However, it suctions the waterline well and cleans the entire pool in a matter of a few hours. The control panel was a little confusing at first but I figured it out. Really good machine! My dad has a gunite pool And uses the same vacuum and it works like a charm also. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kolten Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with the Performance and Simplicity
customer_reviews.text: The cleaner arrived on time. At first, I was hesitant to buy this due to common lack of confident in such product. It saves hours of labor, lowers electricity bill, and performs a work that cannot normally done by the pool filtration system. Though, I still think these products are still overpriced by just estimating the cost to manufacture these products. But, they do what they are meant to do. Hopefully, it holds up to a good reliability reputation. I would still recommend it as a complimentary tool to help you to clean your pool. It comes with two types of filters: ultra-fine and normal. The packaging is adequate to protect the item through shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Apple Orange

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 11 weeks....then QUIT.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the cleaner for the 11 weeks that it worked. It says it comes with a 2 year warranty and I even purchased an additional warranty. RDW told me it had to have less than 25 hours on it to replace and recommended that I take it to two local pool stores to have it repaired (the local pool stores don't do repairs....they send off the equipment to Dolphin). I spent $700 on a cleaner to have it work for less than 3 months. I don't feel like a repair is adequate after this amount of time. I want a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Bayless

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month
customer_reviews.text: Used the vacuum for just over a month and it has already stopped working. It got stuck at the steps and stopped running, and now won’t resume even after turning off and letting sit for a while and turning back on. Extremely frustrating since we picked this model specifically after hours of researching the various models and products. Our pool is 16x32 inground so it should have been well able to manage our pool and work for longer than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Y.

customer_reviews.title: Life just got more productive.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I am so surprised. We held off getting a pool cleaner because the price is a small fortune. But now that we have it, I will save so much time on pool cleaning. This pool cleaner completely cleaned our 40,000 gal inground pool. I'm actually surprised, because I assumed it would be a big flop of money. But to my amazement, this pool cleaner is the best investment we have made for the pool. Sucks up anything from bugs on the bottom to algae up the sides. Cleaner had no problem reaching 8ft depth and did well in crevasses of pool where the most debris ccumulates.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Best pool cleaner I’ve ever seen
customer_reviews.text: After going through six Pool Rovers in 4 years, I had enough. I wish I had gotten this Dolphin to begin with. It’s a much better cleaner; it does a better job and it’s faster. The cord doesn’t tangle up like the Pool Rover. It climbs walls, and it picks up stuff from the floor that other cleaners would miss. I’m very happy with it and I’m sure it will last longer than what I’ve been using prior. My brother has one too and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

product_meta.title: Dolphin Nautilus CC Plus Automatic Robotic Pool Cleaner with Easy To Clean Large Top Load Filter Cartridges and Tangle-Free Swivel Cord, Ideal for In-Ground Swimming Pools Up To 50 Feet
feature_bullets: Hello, free time! Let the Nautilus CC Plus take over your pool cleaning duties for good. Ideal for swimming pools up to 50 feet, this cleaner will leave your pool sparkling clean in just 2 hours. Spend more time enjoying your pool and less time cleaning.

The clean you need without the hassle. The Nautilus CC Plus was designed to clean your pool, effortlessly. With dual scrubbing brushes and superior filtering capabilities, you can relax knowing your pool’s floor and walls are left exceptionally clean.

Ditch the pumps and hose. Unlike the energy hogs that are pressure and suction cleaners, Dolphins are independent cleaning machines and do not rely on any additional equipment to get the job done. Save energy with every pool cleaning.

Clean your pool with the touch of a button. Schedule the Nautilus CC Plus to clean your swimming pool each week using 3 settings- every day, every other day, or every 3rd day. Pool cleaning has never been easier!

With more than 35 years of cleaning the world’s residential swimming pools, Dolphins provide pool owners with a hassle-free cleaning solution of unmatched performance and longevity. Get back to what really matters; spending time with family and friends.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,630 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
